summary.p: Cannot yet assure the acceptance of [Rudolf Gwalther?] into his house, but would like to do Bullinger the favor and will soon provide a response.

div.p: Greetings. The situation is such that I can neither deny nor agree at this moment. Some have spoken with me about the same matter, and if indeed their children arrive as I expect shortly, there will be a place for yours as well. If not, you see how it is not fair to dedicate effort to just one. Indeed, I have long since rejected this responsibility, but the persistence of people, or should I say authority, is such that I cannot maintain my own purpose in studies. However, my dear Bullinger, as it is right to gratify all good people and as I wish to be counted among the good, I will diligently strive to comply and, as much as possible, deserve your love.
The day before the calends of April.
You will receive a response shortly.
To the distinguished Lord Heinrich Bullinger, brother in Christ.
